_header: To him and to us all God grant
Note: One version formerly listed separately as 1009.5.
_description: A benediction serving as a book tag — four lines

OxfMagd30.Editions:
Coxe,  Henry Octavius. 
             Catalogus codicum mss. qui in collegiis aulisque
                oxoniensibus….
         Oxon: e Typographeo academico, 1852: 19.

PierpontM775.Transcription:
To him and to vs alle god graunteGrace of oure offendyngeSpace
                    to oure amendyngeAnd his face to see at oure endynge

BodLauMis416.Transcription:
To hym and to vs alle god grauntGrace of oure offendyngSpace of
                    oure amendyngAnd his face to se at oure endyng
BodLauMis416.Note:
At end of Trevisa’s translation of De re Militari; scribe
                    signs name ‘John Neuton’, copied at Rhodes 25 October
                    1459.
